description: Post-flop advice for GTO ranges (40% VPIP) in 8-max poker

configurations.tips: Post-flop, play cautiously from SB after RFI with a tight range (premium pairs, strong aces). On dry boards (e.g., K-7-2 rainbow), c-bet for value with top pairs or better. On wet boards (e.g., J-T-9), check back frequently to control the pot and avoid being outdrawn. Be wary of BB’s defense range, which may include speculative hands.

After calling a raise from SB, play post-flop with a balanced range (medium pairs, strong suited connectors). On paired boards (e.g., K-K-7), check-call with middle pairs but fold to aggression unless you have a strong draw. On coordinated boards (e.g., Q-J-8), consider check-raising with gutshots or overcards to extract value or bluff.

Facing a 3-bet from SB, your calling range is strong (QQ+, AJs+, AKo). Post-flop, c-bet aggressively on most boards with top pairs or better (e.g., A-K-5). On draw-heavy boards (e.g., K-Q-J), proceed cautiously—check-call with top pairs but fold to multiple bets unless you improve or have a strong draw.

After raising vs a limp from SB, play post-flop with a wide but strong range (premium hands, suited aces). C-bet frequently on dry boards (e.g., A-7-2) for value, but check back on wet boards (e.g., 9-8-7) to avoid getting outdrawn by speculative hands. Be prepared for limper’s wide calling range.
